001package ca.gc.cra.radar.config;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.validation.Net;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.validation.Strings;
005
006import java.nio.file.InvalidPathException;
007import java.nio.file.Path;
008import java.util.Locale;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.Objects;
011import java.util.Optional;
012
013/**
014 * Configuration for poster pipelines that render reconstructed protocol traffic.
015 * <p>Aggregates per-protocol sources and sinks along with Kafka wiring and decode behavior. Immutable
016 * and thread-safe.</p>
017 *
018 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
019 */
020public final class PosterConfig {
021  private final IoMode ioMode;
022  private final IoMode posterOutMode;
023  private final Optional<String> kafkaBootstrap;
024  private final Optional<ProtocolConfig> http;
025  private final Optional<ProtocolConfig> tn3270;
026  private final DecodeMode decodeMode;
027
028  private PosterConfig(
029      IoMode ioMode,
030      IoMode posterOutMode,
031      Optional<String> kafkaBootstrap,
032      Optional<ProtocolConfig> http,
033      Optional<ProtocolConfig> tn3270,
034      DecodeMode decodeMode) {
035    this.ioMode = Objects.requireNonNullElse(ioMode, IoMode.FILE);
036    this.posterOutMode = Objects.requireNonNullElse(posterOutMode, IoMode.FILE);
037    Optional<String> bootstrap = kafkaBootstrap == null ? Optional.empty() : kafkaBootstrap;
038    this.kafkaBootstrap = bootstrap.map(String::trim).filter(s -> !s.isEmpty());
039    this.http = http == null ? Optional.empty() : http;
040    this.tn3270 = tn3270 == null ? Optional.empty() : tn3270;
041    this.decodeMode = Objects.requireNonNull(decodeMode, "decodeMode");
042
043    boolean kafkaInputConfigured = this.http.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaInput).orElse(false)
044        || this.tn3270.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaInput).orElse(false)
045        || this.ioMode == IoMode.KAFKA;
046    boolean kafkaOutputConfigured = this.http.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaOutput).orElse(false)
047        || this.tn3270.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaOutput).orElse(false)
048        || this.posterOutMode == IoMode.KAFKA;
049
050    if ((kafkaInputConfigured || kafkaOutputConfigured) && this.kafkaBootstrap.isEmpty()) {
051      throw new IllegalArgumentException("kafkaBootstrap is required when Kafka input/output configured");
052    }
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Builds a poster configuration from CLI-style key/value pairs.
057   *
058   * @param args argument map; must not be {@code null}
059   * @return populated poster configuration
060   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if required inputs or outputs are missing or invalid
061   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
062   */
063  public static PosterConfig fromMap(Map<String, String> args) {
064    Objects.requireNonNull(args, "args");
065    IoMode ioMode = IoMode.fromString(args.get("ioMode"));
066    IoMode posterOutMode = IoMode.fromString(args.get("posterOutMode"));
067    Optional<String> kafkaBootstrap = optionalString(args.get("kafkaBootstrap")).map(Net::validateHostPort);
068    DecodeMode decodeMode = DecodeMode.fromString(args.getOrDefault("decode", "none"));
069
070    ProtocolConfig httpConfig = buildProtocolConfig(
071        args,
072        "http",
073        new String[] {"httpIn", "--httpIn", "in", "--in"},
074        new String[] {"httpOut", "--httpOut", "out", "--out"},
075        optionalString(args.get("kafkaHttpPairsTopic")),
076        optionalString(args.get("kafkaHttpReportsTopic")));
077
078    ProtocolConfig tnConfig = buildProtocolConfig(
079        args,
080        "tn3270",
081        new String[] {"tnIn", "--tnIn"},
082        new String[] {"tnOut", "--tnOut", "out", "--out"},
083        optionalString(args.get("kafkaTnPairsTopic")),
084        optionalString(args.get("kafkaTnReportsTopic")));
085
086    Optional<ProtocolConfig> http = Optional.ofNullable(httpConfig);
087    Optional<ProtocolConfig> tn = Optional.ofNullable(tnConfig);
088
089    if (http.isEmpty() && tn.isEmpty()) {
090      throw new IllegalArgumentException("missing inputs: specify httpIn/tnIn or kafka topics");
091    }
092
093    if (ioMode == IoMode.FILE) {
094      boolean kafkaInputConfigured = http.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaInput).orElse(false)
095          || tn.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaInput).orElse(false);
096      if (kafkaInputConfigured) {
097        ioMode = IoMode.KAFKA;
098      }
099    }
100
101    if (posterOutMode == IoMode.FILE) {
102      boolean kafkaOutputConfigured = http.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaOutput).orElse(false)
103          || tn.map(ProtocolConfig::hasKafkaOutput).orElse(false);
104      if (kafkaOutputConfigured) {
105        posterOutMode = IoMode.KAFKA;
106      }
107    }
108
109    IoMode finalPosterOutMode = posterOutMode;
110    http.ifPresent(cfg -> validateOutput(cfg, finalPosterOutMode, "http"));
111    tn.ifPresent(cfg -> validateOutput(cfg, finalPosterOutMode, "tn3270"));
112
113    return new PosterConfig(ioMode, posterOutMode, kafkaBootstrap, http, tn, decodeMode);
114  }
115
116  private static void validateOutput(ProtocolConfig cfg, IoMode mode, String protocol) {
117    if (mode == IoMode.FILE && cfg.outputDirectory().isEmpty()) {
118      throw new IllegalArgumentException(protocol + "Out must be provided for FILE posterOutMode");
119    }
120    if (mode == IoMode.KAFKA && cfg.kafkaOutputTopic().isEmpty()) {
121      throw new IllegalArgumentException("kafka" + protocol + "ReportsTopic must be provided for KAFKA posterOutMode");
122    }
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Returns the IO mode determining input strategy for poster pipelines.
127   *
128   * @return IO mode determining input strategy for poster pipelines
129   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
130   */
131  public IoMode ioMode() {
132    return ioMode;
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * @return IO mode describing where rendered posters should be written
137   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
138   */
139  public IoMode posterOutMode() {
140    return posterOutMode;
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * @return Kafka bootstrap servers if Kafka IO is in use
145   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
146   */
147  public Optional<String> kafkaBootstrap() {
148    return kafkaBootstrap;
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * @return HTTP protocol configuration when enabled
153   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
154   */
155  public Optional<ProtocolConfig> http() {
156    return http;
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * @return TN3270 protocol configuration when enabled
161   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
162   */
163  public Optional<ProtocolConfig> tn3270() {
164    return tn3270;
165  }
166
167  /**
168   * @return decode mode instructing poster pipelines how aggressively to decode bodies
169   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
170   */
171  public DecodeMode decodeMode() {
172    return decodeMode;
173  }
174
175  private static ProtocolConfig buildProtocolConfig(
176      Map<String, String> args,
177      String protocol,
178      String[] inKeys,
179      String[] outKeys,
180      Optional<String> kafkaPairsTopic,
181      Optional<String> kafkaReportsTopic) {
182    Optional<String> inRaw = firstNonBlank(args, inKeys);
183    Optional<String> outRaw = firstNonBlank(args, outKeys);
184
185    Optional<Path> inputDir = Optional.empty();
186    Optional<String> kafkaInputTopic = Optional.empty();
187
188    if (inRaw.isPresent()) {
189      String value = inRaw.get();
190      if (value.startsWith("kafka:")) {
191        String topic = value.substring("kafka:".length());
192        kafkaInputTopic = Optional.of(Strings.sanitizeTopic(protocol + "KafkaInputTopic", topic));
193      } else {
194        inputDir = Optional.of(resolvePath(protocol + "In", value));
195      }
196    } else if (kafkaPairsTopic.isPresent()) {
197      kafkaInputTopic = Optional.of(
198          Strings.sanitizeTopic(protocol + "KafkaPairsTopic", kafkaPairsTopic.get()));
199    }
200
201    Optional<Path> outputDir = Optional.empty();
202    Optional<String> kafkaOutputTopic = Optional.empty();
203
204    if (outRaw.isPresent()) {
205      String value = outRaw.get();
206      if (value.startsWith("kafka:")) {
207        String topic = value.substring("kafka:".length());
208        kafkaOutputTopic = Optional.of(
209            Strings.sanitizeTopic(protocol + "KafkaOutputTopic", topic));
210      } else {
211        outputDir = Optional.of(resolvePath(protocol + "Out", value));
212      }
213    } else if (kafkaReportsTopic.isPresent()) {
214      kafkaOutputTopic = Optional.of(
215          Strings.sanitizeTopic(protocol + "KafkaReportsTopic", kafkaReportsTopic.get()));
216    }
217
218    if (inputDir.isEmpty() && kafkaInputTopic.isEmpty()) {
219      return null;
220    }
221
222    return new ProtocolConfig(inputDir, kafkaInputTopic, outputDir, kafkaOutputTopic);
223  }
224
225  private static Optional<String> firstNonBlank(Map<String, String> args, String[] keys) {
226    for (String key : keys) {
227      String value = args.get(key);
228      if (value != null && !value.isBlank()) {
229        return Optional.of(value.trim());
230      }
231    }
232    return Optional.empty();
233  }
234
235  private static Optional<String> optionalString(String value) {
236    if (value == null) {
237      return Optional.empty();
238    }
239    String trimmed = value.trim();
240    return trimmed.isEmpty() ? Optional.empty() : Optional.of(trimmed);
241  }
242
243  private static Path resolvePath(String name, String value) {
244    try {
245      return Path.of(Strings.requireNonBlank(name, value)).toAbsolutePath().normalize();
246    } catch (InvalidPathException ex) {
247      throw new IllegalArgumentException(name + " is not a valid path: " + value, ex);
248    }
249  }
250
251  /**
252   * Per-protocol poster configuration covering file and Kafka targets.
253   *
254   * @param inputDirectory directory supplying message pairs when using file IO
255   * @param kafkaInputTopic Kafka topic supplying message pairs when using Kafka IO
256   * @param outputDirectory directory for poster outputs when writing to the file system
257   * @param kafkaOutputTopic Kafka topic for rendered posters when using Kafka outputs
258   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
259   */
260  public record ProtocolConfig(
261      Optional<Path> inputDirectory,
262      Optional<String> kafkaInputTopic,
263      Optional<Path> outputDirectory,
264      Optional<String> kafkaOutputTopic) {
265    /**
266     * Normalizes protocol-specific configuration values.
267     *
268     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
269     */
270    public ProtocolConfig {
271      inputDirectory = inputDirectory == null ? Optional.empty()
272          : inputDirectory.map(path -> path.toAbsolutePath().normalize());
273      kafkaInputTopic = kafkaInputTopic == null ? Optional.empty() : kafkaInputTopic;
274      outputDirectory = outputDirectory == null ? Optional.empty()
275          : outputDirectory.map(path -> path.toAbsolutePath().normalize());
276      kafkaOutputTopic = kafkaOutputTopic == null ? Optional.empty() : kafkaOutputTopic;
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * @return {@code true} when Kafka should be used as the input source
281     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
282     */
283    public boolean hasKafkaInput() {
284      return kafkaInputTopic.isPresent();
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * @return {@code true} when Kafka should be used as the output sink
289     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
290     */
291    public boolean hasKafkaOutput() {
292      return kafkaOutputTopic.isPresent();
293    }
294
295    /**
296     * @return file-system input directory if configured
297     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
298     */
299    public Optional<Path> inputDirectory() {
300      return inputDirectory;
301    }
302
303    /**
304     * Returns the Kafka input topic if configured.
305     *
306     * @return Kafka input topic if configured
307     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
308     */
309    public Optional<String> kafkaInputTopic() {
310      return kafkaInputTopic;
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Returns the file-system output directory if configured.
315     *
316     * @return file-system output directory if configured
317     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
318     */
319    public Optional<Path> outputDirectory() {
320      return outputDirectory;
321    }
322
323    /**
324     * Returns the Kafka output topic if configured.
325     *
326     * @return Kafka output topic if configured
327     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
328     */
329    public Optional<String> kafkaOutputTopic() {
330      return kafkaOutputTopic;
331    }
332
333    /**
334     * Returns the configured file input directory or throws when absent.
335     *
336     * @return input directory
337     * @throws IllegalStateException if file IO is not configured
338     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
339     */
340    public Path requireInputDirectory() {
341      return inputDirectory.orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException("file input not configured"));
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * Returns the configured Kafka input topic or throws when absent.
346     *
347     * @return Kafka topic
348     * @throws IllegalStateException if Kafka input is not configured
349     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
350     */
351    public String requireKafkaInputTopic() {
352      return kafkaInputTopic.orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException("kafka input not configured"));
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Returns the configured file output directory or throws when absent.
357     *
358     * @return output directory
359     * @throws IllegalStateException if file output is not configured
360     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
361     */
362    public Path requireOutputDirectory() {
363      return outputDirectory.orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException("file output not configured"));
364    }
365
366    /**
367     * Returns the configured Kafka output topic or throws when absent.
368     *
369     * @return Kafka topic
370     * @throws IllegalStateException if Kafka output is not configured
371     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
372     */
373    public String requireKafkaOutputTopic() {
374      return kafkaOutputTopic.orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException("kafka output not configured"));
375    }
376  }
377
378  /**
379   * Controls how aggressively poster pipelines decode transfer/content encodings.
380   *
381   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
382   */
383  public enum DecodeMode {
384    /** Skip all decoding; emit raw payloads. */
385    NONE,
386    /** Decode transfer encodings (chunked, etc.) but preserve content encodings. */
387    TRANSFER,
388    /** Decode both transfer and content encodings. */
389    ALL;
390
391    /**
392     * Parses textual CLI input into a decode mode.
393     *
394     * @param value string such as {@code "none"}, {@code "transfer"}, or {@code "all"}
395     * @return decode mode
396     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if value is unknown
397     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
398     */
399    public static DecodeMode fromString(String value) {
400      if (value == null) {
401        return NONE;
402      }
403      switch (value.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT)) {
404        case "none" -> {
405          return NONE;
406        }
407        case "transfer" -> {
408          return TRANSFER;
409        }
410        case "all" -> {
411          return ALL;
412        }
413        default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown decode mode: " + value);
414      }
415    }
416
417    /**
418     * @return {@code true} if transfer encodings (e.g., chunked) should be decoded
419     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
420     */
421    public boolean decodeTransferEncoding() {
422      return this == TRANSFER || this == ALL;
423    }
424
425    /**
426     * @return {@code true} if content encodings (e.g., gzip) should be decoded
427     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
428     */
429    public boolean decodeContentEncoding() {
430      return this == ALL;
431    }
432  }
433}
434
